intro: Fagara waianensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian fagara, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its compound leaves and fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforest canopy. Its flowers are small and yellowish, often clustered in inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy fruits. Due to its limited geographic distribution and habitat specificity, Fagara waianensis is considered a rare and endemic species.
